body:
Oh, I was expecting `Observe service mesh` including tracing info with agent auto installed and configured. Ok, got it.
From [GO2Sky](https://github.com/SkyAPM/go2sky), `we configure GO2Sky to export to OAP server, which is listening on oap-skywalking port 11800`, does that mean, the agent method is not Envoy based tracing, instead it instruments and exports tracing info to OAP server all by the application itself? With the ENVOY-BASED tracing, Envoy will generates request IDs and trace headers and sends the generated trace spans to the tracing backends.

> Basically, good to me.
> 
> 1. Some empty lines should be removed, the first line of many classes.
> 2. Please add comments for classes and important methods.

Done. Please review :)

> Oh, I was expecting Observe service mesh including tracing info with agent auto installed and configured. Ok, got it.

Technically impossible, sorry :)

> we configure GO2Sky to export to OAP server, which is listening on oap-skywalking port 11800, does that mean, the agent method is not Envoy based tracing, instead it instruments and exports tracing info to OAP server all by the application itself? With the ENVOY-BASED tracing, Envoy will generates request IDs and trace headers and sends the generated trace spans to the tracing backends.

Envoy tracing is tracing the things inside the envoy. It doesn't replace the code instrumentation. 

Then envoy tracing progress is lead by Envoy core maintainers, https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/issues/12486. You could show you interests there, which should accelerate the progress
Yup, thanks, will followup there.
Currently, we don't provide option to close this.

@wu-sheng I'm fixing the same problem with @beiwangnull. Main service access etcd cluster via jetcd, with mTLS enabled. Also using skywalking.

@devkanro before asking, I've verified setting any one of domains in the cert works fine. What if etcd node with the authority domain goes down?

@francis177 
I think it will work fine, the value of authority just used for auth. Actually, the client will not connect to authority if you don't set it in endpoints.

> Hi @naah69, For your case the quick fix is downgrade the client version ,
> since your rocketMQ server version is 4.3, you can downgrade the rocketmq-spring-boot-starter version from 2.1.0 to 2.0.1, I test is in my local env. it is ok. you can try and let me know

3q,i will try it y

> Hi @naah69, For your case the quick fix is downgrade the client version ,
> since your rocketMQ server version is 4.3, you can downgrade the rocketmq-spring-boot-starter version from 2.1.0 to 2.0.1, I test is in my local env. it is ok. you can try and let me know

OMG.maybe i just can wait for 8.2.0 agent,becaust i use new feature `consumeTimeout` in annotation of rocketmq-spring-boot-starter-2.1.0.

it is not support in rocketmq-spring-boot-starter-2.0.1.
To fix the NullPointer,  You can also upgrade your server version greater than 4.4
@devkanro I set etcd cluster's endpoints []String as client's endpoint, not single etcd node
may be close is a good choose, thx
in production envirements, we use rocketmq of aliyun version,so i don't know which corresponding version of open source version ，i had submit work order  to ask version
@wu-sheng thx for review first,would be add unit test later.

And i also have a idea to define a business exception annotaion for distinct business exception rather than system errror.
But when implement it, the method need to add a param(Throwable), the method is referenced by many plugin methods.
Do u have some idea to deal with it?

there should be some bug, let me check
I am not sure whether this is a bug. In SkyWalking, we consider max CPU usage to 100%, so we divide CPU core number.

The top command shows one core CPU usage. So it could be 800% even 1600%.
The reason we did this, is better for alarm threshold setting. Anyway, @xbkaishui this is the tips for you.
Thanks， let me check the logic
This is the expected case. If you notice the query protocol, it is an int/long.
Less than 1% usage would be expected as 0. If you want this away, we need to change JVM handler, make the <= 1 to 1 always.
ok, that make sense. will change that
UI is open for contributions, please try to submit the pull request.

Please don't submit duplicate issues, we have explained this many times. And we have the doc for the configuration if you want to all available threads. https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/backend-setup.md#configuration-vocabulary
Closing, no update in 2 weeks.

> UI is open for contributions, please try to submit the pull request.

OK
I don't know any configuration could cost this lock. This seems more like a bug but only tagged in 7.3 and 8+. Are you using those versions?
Java High Level REST Client ：6.3.2    elasticsearch ：6.7
close https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/4212 via https://github.com/apache/skywalking-client-js/pull/7
I don't have feedback about this. But you could consider updating the ES client to 6.7
Ok, I'll try ES Client 6.7 first. Is there a recommended version of ES7?

> I encountered similar issues several times. might we not create tmp files in e2e.

E2E tests never ever run the unit tests, thus won't cause the failure `MultipleFilesChangeMonitorTest.test:81`, E2E tests indeed generate tmp files, but they should not be monitored by the aforementioned test case, and the E2E failed because of timeout (now)

> @devkanro We just need the remote name or network address. I think we could get that from the stub initialization, right?

@wu-sheng 
The remote name or network address will not be resolved in stub initialization...
The `ManagedChannelImpl` will call the start method of `NameResolver`, and use the listener to get resolve result.
Maybe hook the stub is not a good choose, we should focus on the `NameResolver` or `SmartNameResolver`. 

Support `NameResolver` for all cases, `SmartNameResolver` for jetcd case. `NameResolver` supporting will be a little complex, `SmartNameResolver` will be easy to support.

For jetcd case, we can detect the grpc client created by jetcd client, and set the default authority to `ExitSpan` if authority not be set.
